elements.2211.03038_6768a56f07841f1cb9f6654d04f59: Speech data on the Internet are proliferating exponentially because of the emergence of social media, and the sharing of such personal data raises obvious security and privacy concerns
elements.2211.03038_c804b0b4a6700539c116b8f65daf6: One solution to mitigate these concerns involves concealing speaker identities before sharing speech data, also referred to as speaker anonymization
elements.2211.03038_a08d4faeb0dec807165b8081f7d10: In our previous work, we have developed an automatic speaker verification (ASV)-model-free anonymization framework to protect speaker privacy while preserving speech intelligibility
elements.2211.03038_28deb2d53485abad4f66c1e8a3243: Although the framework ranked first place in VoicePrivacy 2022 challenge, the anonymization was imperfect, since the speaker distinguishability of the anonymized speech was deteriorated
elements.2211.03038_c28f680db18894b1941600d098028: To address this issue, in this paper, we directly model the formant distribution and fundamental frequency (F0) to represent speaker identity and anonymize the source speech by the uniformly scaling formant and F0
elements.2211.03038_0045efd4a85d88fddc952977f7562: By directly scaling the formant and F0, the speaker distinguishability degradation of the anonymized speech caused by the introduction of other speakers is prevented
elements.2211.03038_9bdd98639a7dd5cf97702c0b3d1d3: The experimental results demonstrate that our proposed framework can improve the speaker distinguishability and significantly outperforms our previous framework in voice distinctiveness
elements.2211.03038_36736d748b2bcb8358fcadc8e141b: Furthermore, our proposed method also can trade off the privacy-utility by using different scaling factors.
elements.2211.03038_815383df0cab771dc0c002af57c14: Speaker anonymization, privacy protection, voice privacy challenge
elements.2211.03038_3a21b7b2313be18851e64518b4267: Speech data contains a large amount of sensitive personal information and is vulnerable to illegal exploitation by attackers
elements.2211.03038_db2be65b5661f440350f6e018d318: With the development of speech technology and new regulations such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) in the European Union
elements.2211.03038_78c7d48077f52b2928f3e830499a5: , privacy preservation and protection of personal data have drawn more attention.
elements.2211.03038_b112d706489e11974e347ee78b580: As a solution to speech privacy protection, speaker anonymization techniques have been developed to prevent personal speech data attacked by malicious systems
elements.2211.03038_e3f8b758474a9f2ba7eb945368d32: Ideally, these techniques should preserve speech intelligibility and naturalness while suppressing speaker information, preventing the anonymized speech from being linked back to the original speaker
elements.2211.03038_d39a171a9e794f1e4e5d68426bf27: The task of speaker anonymization was firstly defined by the initiative called VoicePrivacy 2020 Challenge, which also introduced protocols, datasets, and metrics
elements.2211.03038_f1bc19afa3d723ddc476f02474b00: However, the challenge supposed the knowledge level of attackers was ignorant or lazy-informed, which was an improper scenario setting and reduced the difficulty of the anonymization system
elements.2211.03038_0db56fdde00dd4f06b4c2ffe67b10: A common understanding of VoicePrivacy is still in its infancy, and the measure metrics should be involved in more aspects, e.g., voice distinctiveness and paralinguistic attributes
elements.2211.03038_88bd96a9bdc9ac85a22dd840c31c1: , as the continuation of the VoicePrivacy 2020 Challenge, focuses on concealing speaker identity to the greatest possible extent while reserving the voice distinctiveness and paralinguistic attributes intact, as well as linguistic information
elements.2211.03038_6c6c3bd484d0d8586348e0886efeb: In the attack model part, the knowledge level of the attacker is assumed as half-informed, which can use the anonymized training data to fine-tune the attack model.
elements.2211.03038_6fb3f0711fec9746d106adb2e67a0: Generally, the majority of previous anonymization systems can be broadly classified into two classes: signal processing based systems and x-vector based systems
elements.2211.03038_13aa01a9574323ebfbd1483ee620a: The signal processing based methods don't require any training data and directly modify formant, fundamental frequency, or other signal-related attributes of the speech signal to achieve anonymization
elements.2211.03038_cc11a1dd7e90b0325ae8a72fbdeaf: These systems provide higher naturalness and are more distinguishable but less effective at protecting the speaker identity
elements.2211.03038_e83cc31f4958a38dd4263c1cb6541: However, the scope of physical shifts for speech signals is limited
elements.2211.03038_db59c0bcdcf3c817f43c49d0a7d5f: One might be able to restore the original speech after a reasonable number of attempts
elements.2211.03038_acce880cb3917ac579f0187fcc5fc: In contrast, x-vector based systems use the mean x-vector of candidate x-vectors to produce a different anonymized pseudo speaker, which achieves better privacy protection than signal processing based systems
elements.2211.03038_95a2d8e315bb572c1175e309b9656: However, due to the introduction of other speaker information, x-vector based systems are not as well as the signal processing based systems in terms of speaker distinguishability and paralinguistic information retention
elements.2211.03038_57b72f0e0317957eae2877b7b07a6: Furthermore, the x-vector based approach is difficult to flexibly trade off privacy-utility.
elements.2211.03038_3e98d1cab2e1b4633bb3ecdb9ee83: In the VoicePrivacy 2022 challenge, we have developed an automatic speaker verification (ASV)-model-free anonymization framework and ranked first place in four evaluation conditions
elements.2211.03038_d4b05f19396581a8baea9dc31eb9c: Our previous framework used a look-up table (LUT) to replace the x-vector pool and adopted a similar anonymization strategy as x-vector based approaches
elements.2211.03038_004fc0318fae63b7860e7dbab6057: Although the developed framework is capable of the anonymization tasks, we find that the introduction of the averaged speaker embedding deteriorates the speaker distinguishability, that is, the anonymized speech from different speakers cannot be clearly distinguished.
elements.2211.03038_706d937e056a7eab8153ccdd3b4ef: In this study, to tackle this speaker distinguishability problem, we propose to directly model the formant distribution and fundamental frequency (F0) from source speech that is free from additional information from other speakers
elements.2211.03038_ddeacca65f55ca17019bba2161f29: The x-vector pool or LUT is replaced by the formant and F0 to represent the speaker information
elements.2211.03038_53494e9d6d591141389d00d8cc96a: During the anonymization process, we uniformly scale the formant and F0 in each frame to suppress the speaker information, in case of being linked back to the original speaker
elements.2211.03038_aa42cf5c5a6bcbb6cf46ff230cb84: Moreover, the proposed framework can trade off the privacy-utility by using different scaling factors
elements.2211.03038_7648fc0ea9ed05571f12637a00494: Experimental results show that the speech anonymized using the proposed framework significantly outperforms our previous framework in speaker distinguishability while achieving comparable results in privacy protection and speech intelligibility.
elements.2211.03038_f424dc3d84b9c9dae3626af5d48fd: In our previous work, we proposed an ASV-model-free anonymization framework
elements.2211.03038_c5eb745669818a9df99a493d2ad4e: This framework consists of a feature extraction module, an acoustic model and a vocoder
elements.2211.03038_e253ffa57880ce15bae90d8c249cf: The feature extraction module extracts F0, bottleneck feature (BN), and speaker ID from input speech by the YIN algorithm
elements.2211.03038_fbb67792f1c4d4ad83280a462a7b7: Speaker ID is utilized to generate speaker embedding by a speaker encoder and controls the speaker identity
elements.2211.03038_ae86f69f21630bdd302c6a8fdf1cb: An encoder-decoder architecture is utilized as the acoustic model
elements.2211.03038_1065f0f6b9f85dbfc3918cd07365d: , which does not contain an attention mechanism, as the encoder because the BN and the acoustic features are initially aligned
elements.2211.03038_e01c8f6d00264dcdb24db74dea6db: The decoder utilizes an autoregressive model to improve the quality and intelligibility of the reconstructed Mel-spectrogram
elements.2211.03038_7ef7977c0f17f25136814335888bc: As for the vocoder, we modify HifiGAN with multi-band processing
elements.2211.03038_bbfda755b6163fb5536901a308572: The modified HifiGAN generator takes Mel-spectrograms as input and produces sub-band signals instead of full-band signals
elements.2211.03038_320641f5e942a459614047acd976a: In the upsampling module, 4 sub-bands are predicted simultaneously through 3 upsampling layers with 2x, 5x and 5x factors respectively, resulting in a 200x upsampling finally.
elements.2211.03038_2d442e1fad6be68fb3ce8fdb97297: As for the anonymization strategy, the previous framework combines two types of speaker embeddings which are generated by the speaker encoder
elements.2211.03038_30cac7e3daadff637e9bd79e72488: The first one is a pseudo speaker embedding generated using a reserved pseudo speaker ID and does not correspond to any real speaker
elements.2211.03038_eecfc03b32210554e3648039d161a: The other one is an averaged embedding which averages the randomly selected speaker embeddings
elements.2211.03038_f11b9c015e3c8fa8433e186da4488: The averaged speaker embedding and the pseudo speaker embedding are weighted concatenate to generate the anonymized speaker embedding.
elements.2211.03038_77fece418c6c3c7b6d02ec9e1abd0: The averaged speaker embedding guarantees that each trial utterance from different speakers is anonymized by different anonymized speaker embeddings, while all trial utterances from a given speaker are anonymized by the same anonymized speaker embedding.
elements.2211.03038_35a9d8bb2ab3400cb5e5542044b9a: Although our previous anonymization framework ranked first place in all conditions of the VoicePrivacy 2022 Challenge, there is still an apparent drawback compared with a satisfactory anonymization system, that is, distinguishability performance is poor
elements.2211.03038_09b203449c199a4bdfd104e7842c0: The main reason is that each speaker has their own voice distinctiveness and the averaged speaker embedding introduced by the anonymized embedding may severely erode such distinctiveness.
elements.2211.03038_dc498a2ddd47f5444f220e517a5f7: What's more, the capacity of the previous framework to produce distinctive voices is also limited by the size of the look-up table and the number of speakers in the datasets.
elements.2211.03038_cd3932e729d76c55d7a3a9b950b30: Since only the signal processing based method can avoid the introduction of an averaged speaker, which causes the distinguishability degradation, we propose to directly scale the formant and F0 in our distinguishability anonymization framework
elements.2211.03038_8c29a18529e27fe8c6d109e6ba17a: Compared with our previous framework, the proposed framework models formant and F0 by formant encoder and F0 encoder to control speaker identity instead of using LUT, without introducing any information from other speakers
elements.2211.03038_6bec4965d263a8a1b23fd4387885a: shows an overview of our proposed anonymization framework.
elements.2211.03038_be205aa928d7c60d7a045d09d65d0: Our proposed framework consists of three major parts: (1) a feature extraction module, (2) an acoustic model, and (3) a vocoder.
elements.2211.03038_b3747deef030ce4ccbba53f92736c: A speech signal is anonymized by three steps
elements.2211.03038_6288e64e2baabe788463efb7596d0: First, the feature extraction module extracts BN, formant and F0 from the original speech signal
elements.2211.03038_a8f40f9a4c80b6d8957838439c69a: Then, the acoustic model predicts anonymized Mel-spectrogram by BN, scaled formant and F0
elements.2211.03038_99a87a00284cb6913e5410e109cd8: Finally, the vocoder reconstructs the anonymized Mel-spectrogram to signal.
elements.2211.03038_0120d3a7e2717417b48451ab71ae3: to extract F1-F5 formants and F0
elements.2211.03038_467fae4db8467d26f8e9b90a9ead4: The purpose of the ASR encoder is to extract speaker-invariant representation
elements.2211.03038_1b48e1d3c14d0e6b03b5ac8ba7e5d: , is used to extract BN as in our previous work.
elements.2211.03038_ace9db38e129517e051d0f44b402e: In addition to using the same CBHG encoder and autoregressive decoder as in our previous framework, the formant encoder and F0 encoder are also added to the acoustic model
elements.2211.03038_d464fb62caa78e332a9f11b2cfe60: The formant encoder and F0 encoder architectures are shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03038_6d6bf8d1a5289dc6c8d228c4dc481: (a) and (b), they have the same architecture of a stack of two convolutional neural networks with a kernel size of 3
elements.2211.03038_eb5fe8c2a4314730ccb812307f96b: Differently, the output of the formant encoder is the distributions of the formant, while the high level representations are the output of the F0 encoder
elements.2211.03038_2d3fb16f179410c4f46b11d902310: A dropout layer is also utilized at the beginning of the convolutional block to make the training process more stable
elements.2211.03038_2416927642e5f9414fd08512485e9: We adopt the L1 loss as the reconstruction loss to optimize the predicted Mel-spectrogram.
elements.2211.03038_73041b53f54f0df2d86fb3eadfc3a: Since the output of the acoustic model is the same as the previous framework, the same vocoder and training losses are used as our previous framework.
elements.2211.03038_8531435bfd0bd0543c7380d5919fd: Since most voice information is preserved in the F0 and formant frequency ranges
elements.2211.03038_53ed38e262acd473f8a69d2e65157: , whereas linguistic information is preserved in the relative formant frequency ratios
elements.2211.03038_3d78faa597d899bcaec6bbe394954: Therefore, uniformly scaling the formant and F0 is able to suppress the original speaker information while retaining the linguistic information
elements.2211.03038_967d628449020a8d3f33c6a13c9e9: We devise two anonymization strategies for scaling the formant and F0 of the source waveform, which can effectively preserve privacy and speaker distinguishability
elements.2211.03038_a83091a1c119c80a558e0c0b7822d: , which scales the formant and F0 using the same factor directly for different genders
elements.2211.03038_4b541056fafe320c4e17a10558d98: is the scaling factor, the formant and F0 from the source speech are denoted as
elements.2211.03038_b182d995c8ce689ff995af90dee1d: The first scaling strategy is as follows:
elements.2211.03038_651772464087b1ce88562974f95c5: are the anonymized formant and F0, whose original speaker identity is suppressed
elements.2211.03038_882fa32e125906d5cd8e530970c3c: , which takes the differences between male and female in formant frequency and F0 into consideration
elements.2211.03038_d01768ab06b727cdd360f7db8790a: In general, female has higher formant frequency and F0 than male
elements.2211.03038_6b879175bed0b3827e8d9ac70189d: , so we use different scaling factors to adjust the source formant and F0 for different genders as follows:
elements.2211.03038_12224865fc360da89523ef4719b8e: The formant and F0 of the male speakers are enlarged by a factor of
elements.2211.03038_05ffb87eebe3c48f25003fe27081e: , and the female speakers are reduced by a factor of
elements.2211.03038_7f5c463711dfd48d2adfef64f9923: These factors enable the formant and F0 are not adjusted beyond the minimum or maximum range.
elements.2211.03038_2b042185a5078673e6e64728f5c22: We use the same datasets as we employed in the VoicePrivacy 2022 Challenge
elements.2211.03038_17f78d3219b40fbb5cdee65d29cbc: That is, the ASR model is trained on LibriSpeech-clean-100 and LibriSpeech-other-500 datasets
elements.2211.03038_5644e38bb88a69c11bf3c15964b39: , while the LibriTTS-clean-100 and LibriTTS-other-500 datasets
elements.2211.03038_6a667703095217ee5546477925326: are used to train the acoustic model and vocoder
elements.2211.03038_a5cae49dee6e74c8e04e60928dbda: The evaluation of the systems is performed on VoicePrivacy 2022 challenge LibriSpeech-test and VCTK-test datasets
elements.2211.03038_49ec61b1f8a42bd421c18ad60f75e: Following the VoicePrivacy 2022 challenge configuration, the privacy-utility metrics are the equal error rate (EER) and word error rate (WER), which rely on the official ASV and ASR systems
elements.2211.03038_67c0bb53a1fd143b616f1eff4a7bc: The higher EER represents better privacy protection and the lower WER represents better intelligibility
elements.2211.03038_c659eccb99a63c02e383957f74f78: It is essential to emphasize that anonymization should not only lead to the speaker being de-identifiable but also preserve intonation and speaker distinguishability
elements.2211.03038_c3a7b760b07e103f0137e425de060: Thus, the intonation is measured using the Pearson correlation
elements.2211.03038_fa4a0a05d8e484837075cf57f502e: between the pitch sequences of original and anonymized utterances, denoted as
elements.2211.03038_37128c55b0b4320d5086985954acd: The range of pitch correlation is from 0 to 1, and the higher is the better
elements.2211.03038_e03ebbd46eec0a6a1f07f8a772b67: ) metric is used to measure the preservation of speaker distinguishability, which relies on voice similarity matrices
elements.2211.03038_52c24ea555b054060f139445bae45: The voice distinctiveness remains the same when
elements.2211.03038_f47dc731344a0302ae5f44142f15b: and an average increase or decrease in voice distinctiveness are indicated by a gain above or below 0.
elements.2211.03038_0e35c6ff4949323ce169fc8e0e963: Two anonymization strategies are proposed in Sec
elements.2211.03038_2643bcb57c91739f695471525245f: In this subsection, we investigate the effect of scaling factor for the different formant and F0 scaling strategies, respectively
elements.2211.03038_d7d3dd49709b6e14d2079645b0b48: The first one is to test the validity of anonymization using the same scaling factor for different genders, and the second is to test the use of different scaling factors for different genders.
elements.2211.03038_1effef9c5b5e45a06a925ffa67e2d: As for the first anonymization strategy, we control the scaling factor from 0.5 to 1.5 with an interval of 0.2
elements.2211.03038_7a86cfc5a2512fb18b9329eb867de: If the scaling factor is too large or too small, the intelligibility and distinguishability of the anonymized speech are severely degraded
elements.2211.03038_a86e9256fe7daac435af2ff6d70ce: Our selected range covers the reasonable interval between the formant and F0 enlargement and reduction
elements.2211.03038_d5fd56bbadef9b45f634a1758700a: shows the effect of the scaling factor in the range of 0.5 to 1.5
elements.2211.03038_11d06e0313b594515c20198135459: With the scaling factor increasing, the EER results increase first and then decrease
elements.2211.03038_731fae4b9e4f4197c8720a181b9c0: The highest rates are achieved at the scaling factor of 1.5
elements.2211.03038_93458779cd03440ff232116dcec9a: However, the rest anonymization metrics are getting worse when the EER results are rising
elements.2211.03038_d27960209a83088191c6a3ece3fa4: Compared with other intervals, the change of the scaling factor from 0.7 to 0.5 and 1.3 to 1.5 brings the most significant EER raise, but the rest anonymization metrics get worse
elements.2211.03038_ef5c45ae187a2c7a9b9cf640e5e97: This means the same scaling factor strategy is effective when the scaling factor is in the range of 0.7 to 1.3, while the scaling factor out of this range will lead to a degradation.
elements.2211.03038_7f68b31eebbab27be7a5291c6e36f: Except for the overall performance, it is also questionable whether the scaling factor will perform diversely for different genders
elements.2211.03038_3f1d0512b45bb36e771bdc4d27549: When we restrict the relative scaling factor change at 0.1, e.g. scaling factor is 0.9 or 1.1, we observe that the anonymization results of male speakers achieve better performance than female speakers at the scaling factor of 1.1
elements.2211.03038_bfaa12f7deac9062ddefc591cc202: On the contrary, metrics of female speakers achieve better performance than male speakers at the scaling factor of 0.9
elements.2211.03038_13173bc4983aea6581964be24a5da: We believe this is due to the difference in pitch characteristics between male and female, therefore we use different scaling factors for different genders.
elements.2211.03038_3317dfc0f8e8cb7cc4ffb7780e04d: To clearly show the changes in different scaling factors, we compute the average results of the LibriSpeech-test dataset and VCTK-test dataset for four anonymization metrics, shown in Fig
elements.2211.03038_6b26301c9747f50653fad36de1174: We can find the metrics show the same trend as the previous strategy but with better performance
elements.2211.03038_8f9c1966f294f3bca2dbcd57aece3: This demonstrates that using the different scaling factors for different genders can obtain better performance than using the same scaling factor and these two strategies can trade off the privacy-utility
elements.2211.03038_7c0cc58aa58c804d706d2f44d4c2b: On the other hand, when increasing the scaling factor from 0.1 to 0.5, the rise of the EER is getting slower and the rise of WER is getting faster, while other metrics decrease quicker and more significantly
elements.2211.03038_ece8ddb071a15d59a9e589eda1ba0: The best trade-off result is a factor of 0.3.
elements.2211.03038_2399482b967fcb0f96f7fa892f0ea: We configure the gender-dependent scaling strategy with a scaling factor of 0.3 to anonymize the source speech and compare it with other baseline systems
elements.2211.03038_96ec9c71b261d293d52cf5e0b6d15: The VoicePrivacy 2022 Challenge primary baseline systems are considered as our first two baselines
elements.2211.03038_324eee2eb0facc49f6022e8b25453: Our previously submitted anonymization framework is our third baseline system which achieves the state-of-the-art privacy and utility
elements.2211.03038_ee98429fdf150d1071cb541e0d9bf: , the EER of the proposed framework is 34.91
elements.2211.03038_59ae20f55ca295fccd3ec06e5efc7: The average of these two results is higher than other systems
elements.2211.03038_e62db2b1b7e17bc7d8f2f2f80a7cf: metrics that our proposed framework significantly outperforms baseline systems, especially in
elements.2211.03038_5ccc91a151d84f0f23296835f6498: The main reason for these results is the proposed anonymization strategy does not introduce information from other speakers which deteriorates the speaker distinguishability
elements.2211.03038_2deb112501cc1c8ef6d04f0cdcdb6: As for WER results, our framework achieves similar results with VPC-B1.a and VPC-B1.b in Librispeech-test datasets and is substantially lower than VPC-B1.a and VPC-B1.b in the WER of VCTK-test datasets
elements.2211.03038_a0b536362d1feeac574307a446a39: Although our previous framework obtains slightly lower WER results than our proposed framework, the
elements.2211.03038_d5c36a459e8ca9f31b480c8179219: results show that the system is undesirable since it produces a similar voice regardless of which speaker.
elements.2211.03038_b89f23fa82af7d460e1a52845f462: In this study, to improve the distinguishability of speaker anonymization, instead of exploiting speaker embedding, we propose to directly model the formant distribution and F0 to represent speaker identity
elements.2211.03038_4c3d9bc3194b9943a32c0458341c8: The essential idea is to uniformly scale the formant and F0 to suppress the speaker identity while retaining speaker distinguishability and paralinguistic attributes, as well as linguistic information
elements.2211.03038_9e646530ee94eea3fbadf92fde799: The proposed anonymization strategy does not introduce any information from other speakers and prevents speaker distinguishability from being deteriorated
elements.2211.03038_e653fe9fb996769d6a864c6a75596: Experimental results show that the anonymization strategy can trade off privacy-utility well and significantly outperform the baseline systems in speaker distinguishability while achieving comparable privacy and utility results with the state-of-the-art anonymization system.
